Half-Life is one of the best games ever made and that still applies today.

Pros
+Story keeps you involved and engaged taking many twists and turns for a point A to point B story that is original and well crafted.
+Large settings with amazing atmoshpere
+Well designed enemies
+Keeps you thinking about to handle different situations
+Amazing soundtrack which fits the pace of the game perfectly
+ Well made, immersive universe

Cons
-Some of the audio/diologue is dated

Even to this day, Half-Life stands as one of the greatest games ever made and contains hours of involving and enjoyable gameplay.

La storia si apprezza man mano che si gioca.

Un juego muy completo en todos los sentidos, tomando en cuenta la época en la que fue diseñado 10/10
Стал проходить вот чисто из интереса к истории Half-Life. Сразу говорю это игра как по мне большая, и имеет кучу не интересных моментов с другой стороны ей уже 19 лет.

Легенда видеоигр:
В свое время Half-life (период полураспада) был самым настоящим прорывом. Захватывающий сюжет, крутая по тем временам графика, продуманный интелект врагов, ну вобщем обо всем по-порядку

Сюжет:
Он повествует нам о сотруднике лаборатории "Черной Месы" Гордоне Фримане. Однажды, во время эксперемента, произошел Каскадный резонанс, из-за которого открылся портал в Зен. И с этого момента начинаются приключения Гордона Фримена.

Геймплей:
Игра держит в постоянном напряжении, т.к патронов вечно не хватает, а здоровье почти всегда ниже 50. Герою предстоит пройти через коридоры, лаборатории  и прочим местам ,кишаших врагами. Иногда встречаются ученые, которые могут немного подлечить Гордона,  и охраники "Черной Месы", способные помочь в перестрелке. По сюжету вам порой придется решать головоломки .В этом шутере ОЧЕНЬ много мест, где нужно использовать паркур. Интелект врагов  сильно проработан. Противник не будет тупо бежать на вас (как берсерк) ,а будет пытаться обходить.

Звуковое сопровождение:
Оно тут играет очень редко ,а жаль, ведь композициии очень атмосферные и клевые.

Мультиплеер:
Он тут есть, но к сожалению  уже умирает, хотя иногда можно встретить серваки с хотя бы 5 людьми и более.

Баги:
Их немного , но они все же есть. Я не раз порой застревал в текстурах, но для игры 1998 года это простительно .Баги НЕ МЕШАЮТ ИГРОВОМУ ПРОЦЕСУ!


Вердикт:Я считаю , что каждый игрок обязан хоть раз поиграть в  Half-life, ведь класику нужно знать .Вобщем всем советую сыграть в эту игру, а если вам графа не нравится,то сыграйте с модами на графику, или же в Black Messa.

Admittedly I could've worded my last review better.
Half-Life is a classic, but it's not one that holds up that much. It hasn't aged well, I'm trying to say. And I have plenty of reasons why.

[b]-LEVEL DESIGN-[/b]
Atmospherically, Half-Life 1 is amazing. Really. The idea of a scientific complex falling into chaos all around you as you desperately try to escape is executed really well, and it's one of the most atmospheric games of its time.
That's where my positive points end. In terms of level design itself, Half-Life 1 is bad. Really bad. There's no map system which is inexcusable in a game so labryinthine. On top of that, a lot of the levels can get cryptic and annoying, some are nearly impossible if you don't have enough health. Like the dam in Surface Tension, where you have to dodge both a fish monster and helicoptor fire while also standing in place opening a valve for just long enough to start drowning. I've hit roadblocks throughout the whole game, barely going 15 minutes without hitting a dead end and being stuck for twice that time. At least, that's my experience.
Black Mesa does everything so much better. It's really the best version of HL1. If you want a better experience with this game, go get that. Who cares about Xen?

[b]-Gameplay-[/b]
Half-Life's actual gameplay is its strong point. It has lots of unique weapons, all of which are really fun to use. Like, really. There are a LOT of weapons. They're all really cool. Other than that, it's okay. I really don't think I have to describe HALF-LIFE'S gameplay to you. [spoiler]Especially considering you most likely filtered reviews to "Negative" looking for something to be mad about.[/spoiler] But I do like the gameplay. However, as the levels went on, I started noticing a trend in my playstyle. I would just run past all the enemies, speedrunner-style. I don't really know why. Maybe it was the level design making fights unrewarding. Maybe I just wanted to beat the game to get it over with. But the most likely conclusion is that fighting enemies in HL1 is very unrewarding. In most cases you end up taking more damage by fighting than if you just dash through the area. And as mentioned, the level design doesn't help either. Nearly every enemy uses hitscan and sometimes you're pitted up against nearly 8 of them at once in a singe room.

[b]-Rapid-fire of the smaller bits-[/b]
[b]Music:[/b] The game uses music very sparingly. If there's a song, it'll only play once at a key point of the game. So most of the game is quite silent. That's okay, I guess. I don't like silent games, but It's just an excuse to use my own music. The songs it does play are pretty good, though.
[b]Story:[/b] Easily the best part of the game. I already mentioned how much I like the atmosphere, but the story is pretty good. That's all I'll say.
[b]Is it fun?:[/b] Kinda. Things go pretty well until you hit a killjoy roadblock. Something I really like about the game, though, is how small the hitboxes on projectiles are. You can hit someone through the tiniest crack in a wall with a crossbow without the bolt stopping in mid-air on the surrounding walls. If you can see the enemy, you can hit them. Can that be said for many other games? Refer to Level Design for my thoughts on the killjoys.

[b]-Overall-[/b]
Look, I get it. Half-Life 1 is a decent game. But it's not a masterpiece. It has a lot of flaws, and I generally didn't enjoy playing this. I really want to like the game, because it's HALF-LIFE. But too much of the game design frustrated me to the point of never wanting to play it again. I did beat the game. But it felt like a chore more than anything. I didn't enjoy Xen at all. Who does? Really though, if you want to play through the best version of Half-Life, go get Black Mesa. It fixes EVERYTHING this game does wrong, and improves on it. If you want a better first-party Half-Life experience, get HL2. It's way more fun in every way and has its own unique set of weapons.
Overall, Half-Life 1: Good gameplay, ruined by awful level design. That being said though, it is quite moddable. Give the community creations a shot sometime, and you may like it better. [b]6/10[/b]

Good game, since I agree with all the reviewers on the good parts of the game I just thought that I would share two of the problems that I have with the game

1. Bugs 
 a. sometimes when in a vent and entering a new cell, you'll get stuck in the floor and be forced to reload, 
 b. If you activate a valve but you are on the side, next to the wall then you get stuck, sometimes re-activating the valve fixes this, sometimes it doesn't

2. Character speed, to start off I am not good at platforming and the game has multiple platforming areas, but the character is ALWAYS sprinting and you have to shift to walk.  This is extremely annoying when you are trying to jump onto a small space and you correct only to be launched off because Gordon is a sprint first walk later kind of guy.  They fixed this in HL2 but be prepared to have to retry puzzels multiple times.

Besides this fun game, though HL2 is much better, still fun and worth the money.

Gordon. Freeman...
Classic game. Very fun and takes up a lot of time.

Do I recommend this game? Absolutely. It's a great game. And yes, maybe it's graphics have aged a bit, but then so has System Shock's. Whether it's on sale or not, I would recommend it to just about anyone, so here are some pros and cons.

Pros
-Great music and sound effects. They might be aged like the graphics but they still got it.
-Takes the silent protagonist to a whole new level. You'll really feel like you are Gordon Freeman - even if you're a bit mute.
-The game has some choices that actually give you different endings for a little variety (not that they carry over to other games).
-Despite being a FPS/Survival type game, Half-Life has a good story that is felt consistently throughout the game.
-Balanced gameplay and various difficulties for those of varying confidence.
-Unique enemies and weapons.

Cons
-The graphics and sound might not always age well, but this is easily countered by nostalgia.
-Though you can go about your journey in varying ways, it is, to an extent, very linear with little real choices. So if branching, choice-driven storylines are your thing, then this is a con. If not, ignore this.

So that's it from me. Not much I can say wrong about this game. And in my opinion, the cons were a bit of a stretch. So what are you waiting for? Get the game! Or wait for a sale...THEN get the game!

PROS:
- Contextual clues to drive player forward
- 17 Chapters (not inclusive of Endgame and boring ass train sequence) of butt-clamping action
- Immersive action, despite low-end graphics
- The reason why Steam even exists in the first place
- A dank meme
- A tour de force of the first person shooter genre
- Surface Tension canyon skybox

CONS:
- Ladders.
- Xen to Nihilanth chapters are my nightmares
- Quake-level difficulty
- Creepy ambiences
- IVAN GOT CUT FROM THE GAME.

9.8/10

恩，这游戏的意义不必多说。花了我将近20个小时才通关，在下手真是太残。里面操作有的地方确实有点坑，但毕竟是199几年的游戏，但即使我现在玩也能体验到里面的乐趣，时不时的被吓一下，里面的机枪，火箭筒，还有各种高科技武器即使现在都觉得有点小爽。哎，总算是玩过半条命了oo。

Eğer bu oyunu internet kafede bilmediğiniz biz server da tanımadığınız insanlarla oynamadıysanız çocukluğunuzu iyi yamamışsınız demektir... (Oyun gayet iyi, oyunu grafiklerine göre yargılamazsınız sevinirim.)

If you haven't played this game there is something seriously wrong with you. Everyone's probably heard of it, the mods are just outright famous and well-developed, the community is great, what's there not to like?

As for the game itself, it's what began the revolutionizing of FPS shooters. It's something more than simply shooting at bad things. You'll solve puzzles, you'll be thinking a lot, and you'll definitely be immersed in the story.
